topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5533285d6368727ff1731500#post_5533285d6368727ff1731500
When you get down to it Spidey is a street level hero. He'll put as much focus into stopping a purse snatcher as he would stopping Carnage.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@toxicrystal":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553328856368727ff1c21500#post_553328856368727ff1c21500

Depends on continuity. In some he clearly goes out of his way to prevent civilian casualties, going as far as to spare a criminal for the sake of a little child.

In others, he doesn't care much

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553328ce6368727ff1331600#post_553328ce6368727ff1331600
To clarify, We're talking about heroes who would fit in the C class of One punch man's hero association. (Like a guy who mostly sticks to stopping purse snatchers.)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553328f76368723a7fb30900#post_553328f76368723a7fb30900

Yeah but Batman doesn't use lethal force (Which depending on who you ask is worse than killing a guy. "Sure, you'll never walk again and your face looks like a jigsaw puzzle. Still alive though") and goes out of his way to do more than just beating thugs. Heck, he even hires reformed criminals into Wayne Enterprises at several points.

But, continuity is as always a variable

topics.body:
Can someone that's super gay help me out with something?. . . Wait I phrased that wrong.  I'm totally excited for how probably gay marriage is probably going to be legalized, but I've noticed something strange: not everyone in the glbt community is happy about it.  It's almost as if the gay marriage battle almost being over is disappointing people.

Call me crazy, but I think some people are actually getting upset that the gay marriage battle is ending and they're the victor.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553329ff6368726117120100#post_553329ff6368726117120100
[bq="uc9"]Can someone that's super gay help me out with something?. . . Wait I phrased that wrong.  I'm totally excited for how probably gay marriage is probably going to be legalized, but I've noticed something strange: not everyone in the glbt community is happy about it.  It's almost as if the gay marriage battle almost being over is disappointing people.

Call me crazy, but I think some people are actually getting upset that the gay marriage battle is ending and they're the victor.[/bq]
You know when you fight an enemy over and over and over again? You gain a certain understanding and even a strange respect for that enemy. You ENJOY the challenge they bring. And when you see that enemy fall, it feels like you lose a piece of yourself. You're losing someone you've fought for so long that you could almost consider them a friend.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
